message.content:
Here's a healthy 7-day meal plan that adheres to your dietary restrictions:

Day 1:
Breakfast: Scrambled eggs with spinach and tomatoes, whole-grain toast
Lunch: Grilled chicken salad with olive oil and vinegar dressing, mixed greens, cucumber, carrots, cherry tomatoes
Dinner: Baked salmon, quinoa, steamed broccoli

Day 2:
Breakfast: Smoothie made with banana, berries, unsweetened almond milk, chia seeds
Lunch: Quinoa salad with chickpeas, roasted red peppers, olives, feta cheese (dairy), olive oil and vinegar dressing
Dinner: Stir-fried tofu with mixed vegetables, brown rice

Day 3:
Breakfast: Whole-grain oatmeal topped with fresh berries, sliced banana, a sprinkle of cinnamon
Lunch: Turkey wrap with whole-wheat tortilla, lettuce, tomato, avocado, hummus (almond-free)
Dinner: Baked chicken breast, roasted Brussels sprouts and carrots

Day 4:
Breakfast: Greek yogurt parfait with granola (check for almond content), fresh fruit
Lunch: Lentil soup, side salad with mixed greens, cucumber, carrots, olive oil and vinegar dressing
Dinner: Grilled shrimp skewers, rice pilaf, steamed green beans

Day 5:
Breakfast: Whole-grain toast topped with mashed avocado, sliced tomato, a sprinkle of salt and pepper
Lunch: Caprese salad with fresh mozzarella (dairy), tomatoes, basil leaves, olive oil and balsamic vinegar dressing
Dinner: Baked cod fillet, roasted sweet potatoes, steamed asparagus

Day 6:
Breakfast: Smoothie made with banana, unsweetened almond milk, spinach, peanut butter
Lunch: Chickpea salad with mixed greens, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, olives, feta cheese (dairy), olive oil and vinegar dressing
Dinner: Stir-fried chicken with mixed vegetables, brown rice

Day 7:
Breakfast: Whole-grain pancakes topped with fresh berries, a sprinkle of cinnamon
Lunch: Turkey and cheese (check for almond-free) sandwich on whole-wheat bread, side salad with mixed greens, cucumber, carrots, olive oil and vinegar dressing
Dinner: Grilled pork chops, roasted acorn squash, steamed green beans

Remember to consult with a healthcare professional or registered dietitian before making significant changes to your diet, especially if you have any pre-existing health conditions.
